byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from St. Cloud, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Matt Furber from St. Cloud, Christine Hauser from New York, Christina Capecchi from St. Paul, Mark Landler from New York, and Adam Goldman from Washington.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Dahi Adan, man who police say stabbed 10 people at St Cloud, Minn, shopping mall before being shot dead, is described by family and friends as model of assimilation, not violent jihadist linked to Islamic State; he asked at least one victim if he was Muslim.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: “I can’t see anyone more assimilated than that guy,” a family friend said of the young Somali man who stabbed 10 people in an attack claimed by ISIS.
snippet: “I can’t see anyone more assimilated than that guy,” a family friend said of the young Somali man who stabbed 10 people in an attack claimed by ISIS....

headline.main: Friends Say Minnesota Attacker Was ‘Normal American Kid’
headline.print_headline: Minnesota Attacker Called ‘a Normal American Kid’
